intro: Paralysimachia xueshanensis, commonly known as the Xueshan paralysimachia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
